Help Page¶

webvisualization_plots.get_data_from_csv(columns, countries=None, start=None, end=None)¶

Creates pandas dataframe from .csv file. Data will be filtered based on data column name, list of countries to be plotted and time frame chosen. :param columns: a list of data columns you want to include :type columns: list(string) :param countries: List of countries you want to include. :type countries: (list(string), optional :param If none is passed: :param dataframe should be filtered for the 6 countries with the highest: :param number of cases per million at the last current date available in the timeframe chosen.: :param start: The first date to include in the returned dataframe.

If specified, records earlier than this will be excluded. Default: include earliest date Example format: "2021-10-10"

Parameters

end (string, optional) -- The latest date to include in the returned data frame. If specified, records later than this will be excluded. Example format: "2021-10-10"

Returns

returns dataframe for the timeframe, columns, and countries chosen

Return type

cases_df (dataframe)

webvisualization_plots.plot_reported_cases_per_million(countries=None, start=None, end=None)¶

Plots data of reported covid-19 cases per million using altair. Calls the function get_data_from_csv to receive a dataframe used for plotting. :param countries: List of countries you want to filter. :type countries: (list(string), optional :param If none is passed: :param dataframe will be filtered for the 6 countries with the highest: :param number of cases per million at the last current date available in the timeframe chosen.: :param start: a string of the start date of the table, none :type start: string, optional :param of the dates will be older then this on: :param end: a string of the en date of the table, none of :type end: string, optional :param the dates will be newer then this one:

Returns

altair Chart of number of reported covid-19 cases over time.
